page.title: 04EQUESTRIAN
page.content: This is a popular area for the keeping and riding of horses. There is a large proportion of grazing land as well as relatively quiet roads and several bridleways. Many horses and ponies are owned privately and used purely for pleasure. The majority are kept on their owner's farms or small acreage. At several larger stables, racehorses and point-to-point horses are trained taking advantage of the undulating country lanes to get horses fit. A riding school offers lessons,hacking and livery and Haflinger & highland ponies are bred there. Another stud farm breeds larger riding horses and many other mares are kept for breeding, some of them thoroughbred. There is a farrier based in the area working on locally owned horses.
